page.title: 13Arts and Crafts in Knockholt
page.content: This rural area abounds in Arts and Crafts. The age old skills of crochet, rug-making, knitting, embroidery and dress-making are widely practised. A resident visited Belgium, learnt the art of lace making and now teaches it locally. A maker of models produces representative model ships. Flower arranging is a popular hobby and floral tributes are made for weddings, funerals and special occasions, and arrangements decorate St. Katherine's Church. Kneelers for the Church are made by canvas work enthusiasts and artists abound in the area using pastels, water colours and oils - a descendant of John Constable is a resident.
